alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 1:48PM EST until February 19 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Tuscarawas River At Massillon affecting Stark County. For the Tuscarawas River...including Massillon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tuscarawas River At Massillon. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding begins in the Agathon Park area to Route 21. Water encroaches on Route 62 in Navarre. Flood waters may force the closing of two railroad crossings in Massillon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Friday was 18.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM EST.
